evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: the Court has authority to enter a declaratory judgment and to provide temporary, preliminary, and permanent injunctive relief pursuant to Rules 57 and 65 of the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure; the Declaratory Judgment Act, 28 U.S.C. §§ 2201–2202

evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Declare unlawful, vacate, and set aside OJP’s decision to conduct an en masse termination of the putative class members’ grants; (B) Declare unlawful, vacate, set aside Defendants’ terminations of the putative class members’ grants;

evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Declare that OJP’s terminations violate the Fifth Amendment’s Due Process Clause;

evidence.source_document: Plaintiffs' Motion for a Preliminary Injunction
evidence.text: Plaintiffs Vera Institute of Justice, Children and Youth Justice Center d/b/a Center for Children & Youth Justice, Chinese for ... move pursuant to Federal Rule of Civil Procedure 65 for a preliminary injunction.

evidence.source_document: Emergency Motion for Injunction Pending Appeal
evidence.text: Now Plaintiffs seek that injunction under Federal Rule of Civil Procedure 62(d). Plaintiffs seek that injunction pending appeal.
